alert.note: Alert for Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 12:10AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT LICKING COUNTY THROUGH 1245 AM EDT... At 1209 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Johnstown, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Newark, Heath, Granville, Pataskala, Johnstown, Buckeye Lake, Hebron, Beechwood Trails, Harbor Hills, Granville South, Thornport, Jersey, Kirkersville and Alexandria. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 124 and 136. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
